name: Eventopedia
description:
A world where events are stress free & successful.

Eventopedia is on a mission to revolutionise the events industry through the latest technologies & unparalleled industry experience.

Eventopedia is an intelligent lead generation platform for global hotels & venues, and is built by event professionals for event professionals. Eventopedia’s objective is to increase hotel & venue profitability by blending great technology with an intrinsic understanding of the events & wider hospitality industry.  This squaring of intelligence (technology and industry experience) transforms a cost into an investment, which is measured in terms of revenue and positive returns.  

We help the $565 billion global events industry tackle inefficiency by building connected technologies that allow hospitality professionals across two sides of the market to share knowledge and data to drive actionable sales & marketing behaviours.  

Eventopedia is a proven concept, generating ARR with contracted global customers, including Hyatt, Hilton, Marriott and IHG.

jobs.title: Marketing and Accounts Executive
jobs.description:
**Job Title:**	Marketing and Accounts Executive

**Primary Function:** Maximising traffic growth, customer engagement, community building, client value, revenue opportunities and building long-term relationships with all relevant corporate hotels, venues & suppliers 


Eventopedia is a hugely scalable technology business operating in the event technology industry, which is worth $5bn and forecast to grow to $9bn by 2020.  Eventopedia is helping hospitality brands to grow revenues through solutions that cut through the noise and provide planners with relevant information that inform their decisions, cutting both time and waste.

Our long terms vision is to create a world where events are stress free and successful.

To achieve this, we need to build an amazing team. **Here’s where you come in:**

The **Marketing & Accounts Executive** will have a keen and eager nature. As a small team, we are looking for someone who is willing to get stuck in straight away and hit the ground running. You will work alongside our Venue Storyteller EMEA (Marketing & Accounts Manager) to ensure the smooth running of all our Marketing and Client Management efforts. The role would suit someone with a passion for getting creative and thinking outside the box. As a growing start-up, this position has advancement potential within the organisation. 



**Key Responsibilities:**

- Assisting the Venue Storyteller EMEA and team with client and marketing efforts 
- Planning, developing and implementing effective marketing communication campaigns with the team
- Writing copy for all marketing collateral, including blogs, email campaigns and website copy
- Undertaking detailed ongoing analysis of marketing campaigns to ensure targets are met
- Work with colleagues to devise campaigns that meets internal and client strategies
- Assist the organisation of and attend events such as conferences, roundtables and networking receptions
- CRM data input and management
- Measure and report performance of all digital marketing campaigns, and assess against goals 
- Design, implement & manage client reporting to demonstrate value of digital services 
-	Building new relationships and strengthening existing ones 



**Requirements:**

- A great working attitude. We believe that most skills can be learned, so do not be put off if you have less experience than stated
- 2+ years marketing and/or accounts experience
- Commercial awareness and business acumen
- The ability to think strategically
- Copywriting and design skills in order to produce marketing materials for both print and online
- Creativity
- An eye for detail
- Analytical skills to evaluate marketing campaigns and create reports
- Apt in various digital platforms and social media channels

**Desirable/Bonus:**

- PPC and Paid Social Media skills
- Hubspot 
- Project Management Skills



**Behavioural Requirements:**

-	Articulate values, principles and standards 
-	Be Innovative - This is a new position and we welcome you in taking acceptable and informed risks in trying out new approaches and ensure that everyone learns from both successes and issues. 
- Communicate regularly and effectively 
Keep line-managers informed about key activities and progress, together with opportunities, problems and threats.
-	Integrity is fundamentally important to you
-	You are entrepreneurial
Happy and confident to state your opinion and contribute ideas.
-	You are street smart
- You want to make a real difference

Our mission and vision at Eventopedia is to revolutionise the events industry through the alchemy of relevant technologies and industry experience.

**Enquiries and applications to: claire.macmarquis@eventopedia.com **


**About Eventopedia – Vision –** A world where events are stress free and successful.  Eventopedia is re-wiring the events industry with an intuitive, and constantly evolving events platform that enables venues to prosper through provision of qualified leads and channel marketing tools. Eventopedia improves conversions at every stage of the venue sales and marketing process. 

The company’s products also assist event planners – the 5th most stressful job in the world according to Forbes magazine – with their daily jobs, making supplier sourcing frictionless, stress free and enjoyable, enabling planners to deliver more successful events. 

Eventopedia is backed by hospitality industry Angel investors, a private Swiss-family office (Ordway Capital), and is a Microsoft Silver Partner.

jobs.title: Video Production Manager – 12-Months Contract (Initially)
jobs.description:
The Production Manager will have a keen eye for design, a creative passion and flair. You will be highly skilled at running film delivery projects from confirmation of client requirements through to delivery, as well as being competent in resource management, monitoring and reporting on the status of the project.  You will be an effective communicator and will be comfortable working within a fast-paced and ever-changing environment, thriving on daily challenges.

The Production Manager will conduct high-level conversations with their line managers about their project status and their operations.  The successful candidate will be a strong self-motivated and driven individual who is goal-oriented, methodical and tenacious, and can effectively interact with a global virtual team and customers.  As a small growing business, this position has advancement potential within the global organisation.

Key Responsibilities:

	Overseeing the film production & client delivery processes
	Working with the production teams and client Account Directors to ensure smooth planning and organisation of production schedules, where appropriate
	Reporting on project status and workload
	Providing timely communication between relevant departments
	Assessing project and resource requirements with the production teams
	Managing daily schedules
	Determining quality control standards
	Overseeing the production processes
	Ensuring the stages of the project are met according to client and creative brief, budget, resource and deadline deliverables
	Monitoring traffic processes and inputting ideas on how to improve current practices where required
	Working across multiple projects and ensuring all parties are informed of progress and problems
	Building effective relationships with key departments
	Re-negotiating timescales or schedules as necessary 
	Liaising with customer facing Eventopedia team members to ensure regular customer communication & feedback

Requirements:

	A desire to learn and succeed in project management & customer success with a growing tech business
	2+ years traffic management and/or project management experience
	Experience of working directly with internal stakeholders
	Candidates should have one of the following: video production, traffic management, and/or resourcing experience with high volume traffic projects
	The ability to write succinct, crisp emails and a great phone manner 
	The ability to work across multiple time zones
	Adept at briefing creative teams and reporting into clients
	Skilled at working under pressure

Behavioural Requirements:
	Articulate values, principles and standards 
You will be Eventopedia’s primary contact with our clients in the territory. It is essential therefore that you mirror the company’s values and take pride in your role.
	Be Innovative 
This is a new position and we welcome you in taking acceptable and informed risks in trying out new approaches and ensure that everyone learns from both successes and issues. 
	Communicate regularly and effectively 
Keep line-managers informed about key activities and progress, together with opportunities, problems and threats.
	Integrity is fundamentally important to you
	You are entrepreneurial
Happy and confident to state your opinion and contribute ideas.
	You are street smart
	You want to make a real difference
Our mission and vision at Eventopedia is to revolutionise the events industry through the alchemy of relevant technologies and industry experience.

Enquiries and applications to: talent@eventopedia.com
